abilities.name: Final Sting
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Beedrill. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Super Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Radar Jam
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Target Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Delta Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Dragonite is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Dragonite during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Delta Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has δ on its card. You can't use more than 1 Delta Heal Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Flareon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Return Burn
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Flareon to your hand. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Energy Jump
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Rage
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Gardevoir to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Black Magic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Jolteon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Return Spark
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Jolteon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Delta Aura
abilities.text: If you have Latios or Latios ex in play, the attack cost of Latias's Extra Crush is now Lightning MetalColorless.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters fro Latias.

attacks.name: Extra Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent has no Pokémon-ex in play, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Delta Aura
abilities.text: If you have Latias or Latias ex in play, the attack cost of Latios's Psychic Force is now Lightning MetalColorless.

attacks.name: Psychic Force
attacks.text: If your opponent has no Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon in play, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Energy Bone
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Marowak. This attack does 20 damage to each of them.

attacks.name: Metal Crusher
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Metal Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 90.

abilities.name: Delta Control
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the 3 other cards on the bottom of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

abilities.name: Delta Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Mewtwo from your hand onto your Bench, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon (excluding Mewtwo) in any way you like.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to Mewtwo and the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Delta Guard
abilities.text: As long as Rayquaza has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, ignore the effect of Rayquaza's Lightning Storm attack.

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Delta Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy card attached to Salamence.

abilities.name: Metal Navigation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Starmie. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Starmie is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return an Energy card attached to Starmie to your hand.

abilities.name: Crush Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If not, put the card back on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Tyranitar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Delta Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Tyranitar. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Delta Moon
abilities.text: When your opponent attaches a Special Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Delta Moon Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Vaporeon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Return Wave
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Vaporeon to your hand. If you do, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts as evolving Azurill) and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Type Match
attacks.text: Choose a basic Energy card in your hand and show it to your opponent. Then, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card of that Energy type, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Binding Aura
abilities.text: Your opponent can't play any Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve an Active Pokémon and can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to an Asleep Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Delta Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gang Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Darkness Pokémon and Metal Pokémon you have in play.

abilities.name: Backup
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have less than 6 cards in your hand, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Machine Burst
attacks.text: If Porygon2 has a Technical Machine card attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Burned.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Sunny Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Rain Castform. (Any cards attached to Rain Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Rain Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Splash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Holon Energy card attached to Rain Castform.

abilities.name: Delta Storm
abilities.text: As long as Sandslash is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon-ex between turns.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Prize Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a card from your hand and put it as a Prize card face up. If you do, choose 1 of your face-down Prize cards without looking and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition or if all of your Prize cards are face up.

attacks.name: Psychic Option
attacks.text: If Slowking has a Water Energy card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If Slowking has a Psychic Energy card attached to it, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Sunny Castform and switch it with Snow-cloud Castform. (Any cards attached to Snow-cloud Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Snow-cloud Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Blizzard
attacks.text: If Snow-cloud Castform has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Sunny Castform. (Any cards attached to Sunny Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Sunny Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Steep Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swellow during your opponent's next turn. If tails, during your next turn, Swellow's Glide attack's base damage is 100.

abilities.name: Body Odor
abilities.text: As long as Weezing is the Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Bodies between turns.

attacks.name: Mist Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Sunny Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card. If Castform has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, draw 2 more cards.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Ditto.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Ditto performs that attack.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Ditto.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Ditto with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coin. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sonic Signal
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Reversal Aura
abilities.text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, each of Hariyama's attacks does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance) and damage done by the Active Pokémon to Hariyama is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Beacon Protection
abilities.text: As long as you have Volbeat in play, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Illumise by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has Dark in its name.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Strange Rasping
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Kirlia.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Persian from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Pupitar does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Super Singe

attacks.name: Stomp

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Shelgon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Skarmory is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Skarmory by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Extra Protection
abilities.text: As long as you have Illumise in play, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Volbeat by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Bagon.

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: As long as Beldum is your Active Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat Beldum for each Beldum on your Bench.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Beldum does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

name: Dual Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Holon Farmer
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.Search your discard pile for 3 basic Energy cards and any combination of 3 Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Lass
rules: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Mentor
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon that each has 100 HP or less, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Research Tower
rules: Each player's basic Energy cards attached to Pokémon that has δ on its card are both their usual Energy type and Metal type but provide only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Holon Researcher
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.Search your deck for a Metal Energy card or a Basic Pokémon (or Evolution card) that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Ruins
rules: Each player that has any Pokémon in play that has δ on its card may draw a card once during his or her turn. If the player does, he or she discards a card from his or her hand.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Holon Scientist
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.If you have less cards in your hand than your opponent, draw cards until you have the same number of cards as your opponent.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Transceiver
rules: Search your deck for a Supporter card that has Holon in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. Or, search your discard pile for a Supporter card that has Holon in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Master Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

abilities.name: Evolutionary Flame
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Flareon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Flame Screen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Flareon ex by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Flareon ex does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Thunder
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Jolteon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy card attached to Jolteon ex.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Swirl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Vaporeon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may have your opponent shuffle his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, your opponent draws up to 4 cards.

attacks.name: Fastwave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Fighting Energy cards and attach them to Groudon Star.

attacks.name: Ground Slash
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy card attached to Groudon Star.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Water Energy cards and attach them to Kyogre Star.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Metal Energy cards and attach them to Metagross Star.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Azumarill by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
